1.text: Words of Lemuel a king, a declaration that his mother taught him:

2.text: ‘What, my son? and what, son of my womb? And what, son of my vows?

3.text: Give not to women thy strength, And thy ways to wiping away of kings.

4.text: Not for kings, O Lemuel, Not for kings, to drink wine, And for princes a desire of strong drink.

5.text: Lest he drink, and forget the decree, And change the judgment of any of the sons of affliction.

6.text: Give strong drink to the perishing, And wine to the bitter in soul,

7.text: He drinketh, and forgetteth his poverty, And his misery he remembereth not again.

8.text: Open thy mouth for the dumb, For the right of all sons of change.

9.text: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, Both the cause of the poor and needy!’

10.text: A woman of worth who doth find? Yea, far above rubies is her price.

11.text: The heart of her husband hath trusted in her, And spoil he lacketh not.

12.text: She hath done him good, and not evil, All days of her life.

13.text: She hath sought wool and flax, And with delight she worketh with her hands.

14.text: She hath been as ships of the merchant, From afar she bringeth in her bread.

15.text: Yea, she riseth while yet night, And giveth food to her household, And a portion to her damsels.

16.text: She hath considered a field, and taketh it, From the fruit of her hands she hath planted a vineyard.

17.text: She hath girded with might her loins, And doth strengthen her arms.

18.text: She hath perceived when her merchandise is good, Her lamp is not extinguished in the night.

19.text: Her hands she hath sent forth on a spindle, And her hands have held a distaff.

20.text: Her hand she hath spread forth to the poor, Yea, her hands she sent forth to the needy.

21.text: She is not afraid of her household from snow, For all her household are clothed with scarlet.

22.text: Ornamental coverings she hath made for herself, Silk and purple are her clothing.

23.text: Known in the gates is her husband, In his sitting with elders of the land.

24.text: Linen garments she hath made, and selleth, And a girdle she hath given to the merchant.

25.text: Strength and honour are her clothing, And she rejoiceth at a latter day.

26.text: Her mouth she hath opened in wisdom, And the law of kindness is on her tongue.

27.text: She is watching the ways of her household, And bread of sloth she eateth not.

28.text: Her sons have risen up, and pronounce her happy, Her husband, and he praiseth her,

29.text: Many are the daughters who have done worthily, Thou hast gone up above them all.’

30.text: The grace is false, and the beauty is vain, A woman fearing Jehovah, she may boast herself.

31.text: Give ye to her of the fruit of her hands, And her works do praise her in the gates!
